comment.body: I enabled it in CircleCI, and the wizard there created a [new branch and sample config file in our repo](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs-java/blob/circleci-project-setup/.circleci/config.yml).

issue.title: Integrate all of OQS algorithms
issue.body:
Make sure all of OQS's algs are available in OpenSSL.

(I'll start on that, @dstebila)

issue.title: caant add certificate on httpd
issue.body:
whenever I try to create and add test certificate the following error pops up
```
req: Can't open "/opt/tmp/CA.key" for writing, Permission denied
failed to resize tty, using default size
```
on exploring the container files with shell no `tmp`  folder is found and am unable to create it using mkdir
Please help

comment.body:
@kartik2797 So I assume you try to execute 
```
docker run -v `pwd`:/opt/tmp -it openquantumsafe/curl openssl req -x509 -new -newkey qteslapi -keyout /opt/tmp/CA.key -out /opt/tmp/CA.crt -nodes -subj "/CN=oqstest CA" -days 365
```
? 
If so, a permission error indicates a mismatch between your (host) user ID and the one in the (docker) image. There's quite some information available how to rectify this, e.g., [here](https://seravo.fi/2019/align-user-ids-inside-and-outside-docker-with-subuser-mapping) or [here](https://medium.com/@mccode/understanding-how-uid-and-gid-work-in-docker-containers-c37a01d01cf ). 
If not, please provide additional information what exactly you're executing when the error occurs.
Finally got appveyor to work. @dstebila, @vsoftco; can one of you take a look? Ready for merge.

> I can take a look on how to enable circle ci for this project. 

Great @jimouris; you can use the setup @dstebila started.

> However, in order to use the existing dockerfiles, we will need to add an openjdk (`sudo apt install openjdk-11-jdk` and set the java home `export JAVA_HOME="/usr/lib/jvm/java-1.11.0-openjdk-amd64"`) and maven (`sudo apt install maven`) to the existing containers (for instance, in the [ubuntu](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/ci-containers/blob/master/ubuntu-bionic/Dockerfile) and [debian](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/ci-containers/blob/master/debian-buster/Dockerfile) dockerfiles).

@xvzcf, can this be added to the docker image?

issue.title: Integrate all of OQS algorithms
issue.body:
Make sure all of OQS's algs are available in OpenSSL.

(I'll start on that, @dstebila)

comment.body: Not yet. It will be when https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/tree/more-sig-algs is merged into master, but that is pending a decision on what signature algorithms to enable by default.

Yes, I can take a look at it once I'm done with OpenSSL, BoringSSL, and OpenSSH. Perhaps @baentsch can also take a look at it if he's free. 

If not, then for the time being those requirements can be met through CircleCI steps, as done [here](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/blob/OQS-OpenSSL_1_1_1-stable/.circleci/config.yml#L35).

@christianpaquin @xvzcf @jimouris No problem: I'll add openjdk-11-jdk and maven. 
@dstebila I'll let you know when done to push that to docker hub

issue.title: Image build automation
issue.body: This PR would trigger building and pushing to docker hub of the ci images, removing the need for manual build-and-push.

comment.body: CCI ran in 'baentsch' org OK: https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/baentsch/testing/55/workflows/4113e6b9-5eec-4e9f-bb62-1a99a05a3691/jobs/153/steps ; a 'repo admin' (I guess @dstebila or @xvzcf ) would have to activate CCI for ci-containers to also enable this in 'openquantumsafe' org

issue.title: Add back appveyor support for Windows build

comment.body: @baentsch Thank you. I ended up using a dockerfile that CircleCI provides (`circleci/openjdk:9-jdk`) and installed the liboqs dependencies and liboqs there. It works now. For some reason although I was able to install java to the ubuntu and debian containers from the ci-conainers repository, JNI was missing.
